reviews.text:
Nice old fashioned train station that has 4 platforms with trains going towards Norwich & London, plus Ipswich, Colchester plus many more connecting services.

There are 2 manned ticket kiosks with helpful staff to purchase your tickets or ask for advice from, there are clear live departure boards & a good undercover area for when its raining with a cafe & lots of useful information, as well as a local bus that stops outside (1b) to take you to the town or the bus station for a connecting service plus a taxi rank.
Arrived at station for train and its closed no toilet facilities to use no shelter from the rain very disappointed

Very nice old fashioned rail station, ticket office just inside entrance, greasy spoon style cafe with seating and tables.... Old toilets although seem to be kept clean, place to sit in the warm and charge phone/laptop/tablet... Also has a bookshelf to "borrow" a book for your journey... Im sure people don't take them back or drop it off at the next station lol

There are a lot of things I enjoyed about using this station
1) The facilities were spotless and are always cleaned regularly
2) Buying tickets is easy and the ticket machines sell a wide range
3) Greater Anglia staff are very polite and always say hello when you're passing through
But I'm not very happy with the level of rail service that Greater Anglia provides but there is always improvements going on
If you want to buy tickets visit
greateranglia.co.uk 
Or download the free Greater Anglia App
